1.description: A brilliant mathematician who has developed the science of psychohistory, a mathematical discipline that can predict the future of large groups of people.
1.role: Founder of psychohistory and the Foundation

5.description: Revealed to have recorded messages for future generations of the Foundation, appearing through a time vault to guide them during crises.
5.role: Guiding spirit of the Foundation through recorded messages

1.description: A young mathematician from Synnax who comes to Trantor to work with Hari Seldon.
1.role: Student and follower of Hari Seldon

5.description: The pragmatic mayor of Terminus City and leader of the Foundation who believes in political solutions over scientific isolation.
5.role: Mayor of Terminus and Foundation leader

8.description: Successfully navigates the first Seldon Crisis by establishing the Foundation as a religious power among the Four Kingdoms.
8.role: Political leader who turned science into religion for diplomatic advantage

5.description: The director of the Encyclopedia Galactica project and chairman of the Board of Trustees, focused on preserving knowledge.

13.description: A Master Trader of the Foundation who becomes involved in establishing trade relationships with distant worlds.
13.role: Master Trader and future Foundation leader

16.description: Becomes mayor of the Foundation after successfully handling the Korellian trade crisis and proving the power of economic warfare.

9.description: A priest of the Foundation's pseudo-religion on Anacreon who maintains the nuclear power plant.
The regent of Anacreon who plots to attack the Foundation and seize its technology.
9.role: Prince Regent plotting against the Foundation

9.description: The young king of Anacreon, manipulated by his uncle Wienis in the plot against the Foundation.
The Grand Prior of the Foundation religion on Anacreon, loyal to the Foundation.
A captain in Prince Wienis's forces involved in the plot against the Foundation.

6.description: The king of Smyrno, one of the Four Kingdoms threatening the Foundation.

13.description: Leader of the Actionist party opposing Hardin's policies, advocating for military action.
A Master Trader who helps rescue Eskel Gorov from Askone.
A Foundation representative imprisoned on Askone for trying to introduce nuclear technology.

16.description: The Commdor (ruler) of Korell who initially welcomes Foundation trade but is secretly plotting against them.

13.description: Secretary to Mayor Hardin and leader of the investigation into Hober Mallow.

16.description: A Foundation councilman who accompanies Hober Mallow to Korell as part of the trade mission.

5.description: A young trader who supports Salvor Hardin's political approach over the Encyclopedia project.
An Imperial Chancellor who visits Terminus but proves to be ineffectual and more concerned with social niceties than real help.

13.description: The High Priest of Askone who initially opposes Foundation technology but is eventually convinced by Limmar Ponyets.
An Askonian official involved in the negotiations with Limmar Ponyets regarding Eskel Gorov's fate.

16.description: A Korellian official who deals with Foundation traders and is involved in the trade negotiations.

9.description: An Anacreonian noble involved in Prince Wienis's court and the plotting against the Foundation.

5.description: A Foundation technician working on Terminus, representing the practical workers as opposed to the academic Board.

13.description: A Foundation citizen involved in the political discussions about trade policy and military action.

16.description: A Foundation psychologist who analyzes the political and social implications of the Korellian situation.

1.description: An Imperial archaeologist and scientist who becomes involved with the Foundation's early history.

2.description: Hari Seldon's granddaughter who helps with the early Foundation work and supports her grandfather's vision.
2.role: Seldon family member and Foundation supporter

2.description: A member of the Imperial Commission investigating Hari Seldon's activities and the threat of psychohistory.
Another member of the Imperial Commission, more hostile to Seldon's psychohistory project than Chen.
The Chief Commissioner of the Public Safety Committee investigating Hari Seldon's work.

5.description: A member of the Board of Trustees who supports the Encyclopedia project over political involvement.
Secretary of the Board of Trustees and supporter of Lewis Pirenne's academic approach.

6.description: A prince of Smyrno involved in the Four Kingdoms' threat to the Foundation.

9.description: A Foundation engineer working on Anacreon to maintain the power plants and Foundation technology.

16.description: A Foundation representative who works closely with the trade missions.

13.description: A Foundation trader involved in early attempts to establish trade relationships beyond the Four Kingdoms.

10.description: A courtier in the Anacreonian court involved in the political maneuvering around the Foundation crisis.

14.description: A member of the Actionist party who advocates for military solutions to Foundation problems.

17.description: A Korellian official involved in the trade negotiations and political maneuvering with the Foundation.

1.description: A Foundation scientist working on the early development of psychohistorical mathematics.

13.description: A Foundation councilman involved in the political debates about trade policy and military preparedness.

14.description: A Foundation official involved in the investigation and prosecution of various political matters.

10.description: A Foundation priest working to maintain the religious facade that protects Foundation technology.
An Anacreonian military captain involved in Prince Wienis's plans against the Foundation.

6.description: A Foundation technician working on various technical projects during the early crises.

18.description: An assistant to Hober Mallow during his political rise and trade negotiations.

17.description: The official representative of Korell in negotiations with the Foundation regarding trade agreements.

5.description: Security personnel protecting Foundation facilities and officials during the various crises.

9.description: Local religious officials on Anacreon who have adopted the Foundation's pseudo-religion to maintain their technology.

2.description: Various representatives of the declining Galactic Empire who attempt to deal with the Foundation situation.

6.description: Nobles from the Kingdom of Smyrno involved in the Four Kingdoms' alliance against the Foundation.

13.description: Various commercial agents and trade representatives working to establish Foundation commerce throughout the galaxy.

5.description: The civilian population of Terminus who support the Foundation through various crises.

1.description: The distant ruler of the declining Galactic Empire, largely ineffective in dealing with the Foundation situation.
Various mathematicians and scientists working on the development and application of psychohistory.

5.description: Scholars working on the Encyclopedia Galactica project, the supposed reason for the Foundation's establishment.

2.description: The legal representative assigned to defend Hari Seldon during his trial before the Imperial Commission.
The secretary who records the proceedings of Seldon's trial and manages Commission documentation.

1.description: The captain of the Imperial Guard responsible for security during Seldon's appearances at court.
A librarian on Trantor who assists Gaal Dornick in accessing galactic historical records.
A mathematician serving the Imperial Court who is skeptical of Seldon's psychohistory claims.
A research assistant who works closely with Hari Seldon on psychohistory calculations.

3.description: The Imperial administrator overseeing the initial settlement of Terminus by the Foundation colonists.

2.description: The prosecutor arguing the case against Hari Seldon for treason and sedition.

1.description: Various students and junior researchers working under Seldon to develop psychohistory.

5.description: A member of the Board of Trustees who supports the Encyclopedia project over political involvement.
Another Board of Trustees member focused on maintaining academic integrity of the Encyclopedia project.

6.description: The official representative of Anacreon in negotiations with the Foundation during the first crisis.

5.description: Technical personnel working on Foundation infrastructure and technology maintenance.
Researchers working on compiling the Encyclopedia Galactica, the Foundation's supposed primary purpose.
The head of Foundation security who coordinates defenses against the Four Kingdoms threat.

6.description: Representatives from the Kingdom of Smyrno participating in the Four Kingdoms alliance against the Foundation.
Official representatives from the Kingdom of Konom in the Four Kingdoms alliance.
Military and diplomatic representatives from Daribow, the fourth kingdom threatening the Foundation.

5.description: Administrative assistant working with the mayor's office during the political crisis.

6.description: Officer responsible for maintaining communications with other worlds and monitoring the Four Kingdoms threat.

9.description: The highest religious authority on Terminus who oversees the Foundation's pseudo-religious activities.

10.description: A high-ranking military officer under Prince Wienis who leads the Anacreonian forces.

9.description: Religious missionaries sent to spread the Foundation's pseudo-religion throughout the Four Kingdoms.
Court officials serving in the Anacreonian royal court during the crisis with the Foundation.
Technical specialists who maintain Foundation technology while presenting it as religious ritual.
Noble families at the Anacreonian court involved in the political intrigues surrounding the Foundation.
The supervisor overseeing the nuclear power plant on Anacreon, working under Foundation religious authority.
The general population of Anacreon who have adopted the Foundation's pseudo-religion and depend on its technology.

10.description: The captain of the royal guard responsible for protecting the Anacreonian royal family.

9.description: Diplomatic representatives of the Foundation working to maintain relationships with the Four Kingdoms.

10.description: Citizens from various kingdoms who have converted to the Foundation's pseudo-religion.

13.description: The organized guild of independent traders who operate beyond the Four Kingdoms and challenge Foundation monopoly.
Religious elders of Askone who initially oppose Foundation technology as contrary to their beliefs.
Local merchants on Askone who become interested in Foundation goods and technology.
Captains of Foundation trading vessels who navigate between worlds to establish commerce.
Members of Sef Sermak's Actionist party who advocate for military expansion and direct action.
Members of the Foundation's governing council who debate policy regarding the independent traders.
Guards responsible for holding Eskel Gorov prisoner and overseeing the Foundation representative.
Independent merchants operating outside Foundation control who compete with official trade policy.
The governing council of Askone that makes decisions about Foundation technology and trade relations.
Economic specialists who analyze the impact of independent traders on Foundation commerce.

14.description: Representatives of the various trading guilds and independent merchants who negotiate with the Foundation.

16.description: High-ranking minister in the Korellian government involved in trade negotiations and military planning.

17.description: Admiral commanding the Korellian fleet equipped with Imperial nuclear weapons for the war against the Foundation.

16.description: Secret agents working for the Foundation to gather intelligence on Korell's Imperial connections.
Officials responsible for managing Korell's trade relationships and commercial policies.

17.description: Secret agents of the Galactic Empire working to support Korell against the Foundation.

16.description: Wealthy and influential merchants who have risen to political power through successful trading ventures.

17.description: Scientists working on Korell's independent nuclear technology with Imperial assistance.

18.description: Specialists who develop and implement economic warfare strategies against hostile worlds.

17.description: Military officers commanding Korellian ground forces and coordinating with the fleet.

16.description: The head of Foundation intelligence services who coordinates espionage activities.
Nobles at the Korellian court who participate in the political intrigues surrounding the Foundation.

18.description: Captains commanding Foundation naval vessels during the Korellian crisis.

16.description: The civilian population of Korell who become dependent on Foundation consumer goods and technology.

18.description: Managers overseeing Foundation manufacturing facilities producing goods for export.

17.description: Imperial advisors secretly counseling Korell on military and political strategy against the Foundation.

recaps.1: Mathematician Hari Seldon presents his science of psychohistory to the Imperial court, predicting the Empire's fall and proposing the Foundation as a way to shorten the coming dark age.
recaps.2: The Imperial Commission puts Seldon on trial for treason, but he convinces them to exile him and his followers to Terminus to work on an Encyclopedia Galactica.
recaps.3: Seldon and his group arrive on Terminus and begin establishing the Foundation, ostensibly to compile human knowledge but actually to preserve civilization.
recaps.4: Gaal Dornick learns more about psychohistory and Seldon's true plans as the Foundation begins its work on the remote planet of Terminus.
recaps.5: Fifty years later, the Foundation faces its first crisis as the Four Kingdoms threaten Terminus while the Galactic Empire proves unable to help.
recaps.6: Mayor Salvor Hardin challenges the Board of Trustees' academic focus, arguing that political action is needed to save the Foundation from external threats.
recaps.7: Hardin takes control of the Foundation government, sidelining the Encyclopedia project in favor of dealing with the immediate political crisis.
recaps.8: The first Seldon Crisis is resolved when Hardin turns Foundation science into a religion, making the Four Kingdoms dependent on Foundation technology.
recaps.9: Thirty years later, Anacreon threatens the Foundation again as Prince Regent Wienis plots to seize Foundation technology and attack Terminus.
recaps.10: The Foundation's pseudo-religion has become established throughout the Four Kingdoms, with priests maintaining the nuclear power plants and other technology.
recaps.11: Wienis attempts his coup but finds that the Foundation's religious hold over his people makes military action impossible.
recaps.12: The second Seldon Crisis ends with Wienis's defeat and suicide, as the Foundation's religious influence proves stronger than military might.
recaps.13: Another generation later, the Foundation faces competition from independent traders who operate beyond the religious framework that controls the Four Kingdoms.
recaps.14: Master Trader Limmar Ponyets negotiates the release of Eskel Gorov from Askone, demonstrating the power of economic rather than religious influence.
recaps.15: Political opposition grows on Terminus as the Actionist party, led by Sef Sermak, argues for military expansion to compete with the independent traders.
recaps.16: Hober Mallow travels to Korell as a Master Trader, discovering that the Korellians have Imperial support and nuclear weapons independent of the Foundation.
recaps.17: Mallow establishes trade relationships with Korell while investigating the extent of Imperial involvement in the outer provinces.
recaps.18: The Foundation faces its third Seldon Crisis as Korell, backed by the Empire, prepares for war using nuclear weapons that don't depend on Foundation religion.
recaps.19: Mallow becomes mayor and defeats the Korellian threat through economic warfare, proving that trade and economic dependence are more powerful than military force or religion.
